title: 1952 NCAA football rankings
text:
Two human polls comprised the <a href="1952%20college%20football%20season">1952</a> <a href="National%20Collegiate%20Athletic%20Association">National Collegiate Athletic Association</a> (NCAA) football rankings. Unlike most sports, college football's governing body, the NCAA, does not bestow a <a href="national%20championship">national championship</a>, instead that title is bestowed by one or more different polling agencies. There are two main weekly polls that begin in the preseason—the <a href="AP%20Poll">AP Poll</a> and the <a href="Coaches%27%20Poll">Coaches' Poll</a>.
AP Poll.
The final AP Poll was released on December 1, at the end of the <a href="1952%20college%20football%20season">1952 regular season</a>, weeks before the major bowls. The AP would not release a post-bowl season final poll regularly until <a href="1968%20NCAA%20University%20Division%20football%20rankings">1968</a>.
Final Coaches' Poll.
The final <a href="United%20Press">UP</a> <a href="Coaches%20Poll">Coaches Poll</a> was released prior to the bowl games, on 
<br>Michigan State received 32 of the 35 first-place votes; one each went to Georgia Tech, Notre Dame, and Oklahoma.
